channel.title: Setup on frp
channel.description: Recent content in Setup on frp

item.title: Using systemd
item.description: On Linux systems, using systemd can conveniently control the start, stop, background running configuration, and boot auto-start of the frps server. Here are the specific operation steps: Install systemd If systemd is not yet installed on your Linux server, you can use package managers like yum (for CentOS/RHEL) or apt (for Debian/Ubuntu) to install it: # Install systemd using yum (CentOS/RHEL) yum install systemd # Install systemd using apt (Debian/Ubuntu) apt install systemd Create frps.
